definition: (in the) past/former/previous/to go over/to pass by
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
acceptable/passable/justifiable/(of a course of action) to make sense
Today is the key to the past.
pinyin: xian4 zai4 shi4 guo4 qu5 yao4 shi5

definition: cannot stand by idly and watch/unable to put up with it any longer

sentences.english: I used to go to work by bike. (But I don't anymore, now. )
sentences.chinese: 我过去常骑自行车上班。

sentences.english: EarthSound's products have an excellent track record in the States.
sentences.chinese: 天籁的产品在美国有非常辉煌的过去。

sentences.english: The United States has been the world’s breadbasket for more than half a century.
sentences.chinese: 过去的半个世纪内，美国一直是世界的面包篮子。

sentences.english: For the past few days, there has instead been rioting in the square.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的几天里，广场上没有垃圾，倒是有一场暴乱。

sentences.english: This past offseason there were tons of reports circulating around Kobe Bryant's wish to be traded.
sentences.chinese: 过去的那个休赛期，有很多关于科比想被交易的报道。

sentences.english: No cases have been reported outside Uige for the past five weeks.
sentences.chinese: 在过去5周内在威热省之外未报告发生病例。

sentences.english: Tears are sometimes rolling down from your cheek whenever thinking of the past painful hardship and hurting experience.
sentences.chinese: 每当想起过去痛苦与伤心，眼泪总是潸然流下。

sentences.english: The past is a good place to visit, but certainly not a good place to stay.
sentences.chinese: 过去，是我们偶尔到访的好去处，但显然不宜长留。

sentences.english: Emerging Asia has grown by an annual average of 8% over the past three years—as fast as before the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 过去三年来以年均8%的速度增长着，和危机前一样。

sentences.english: The point of our pacification operations was always described as "winning the hearts and minds" of the people.
sentences.chinese: 我们绥靖行动的意义过去一贯被描写为“深得人心。”

sentences.english: In a village there lived two men who had the self-same name.
sentences.chinese: 过去有两个人住在一个村子里。

sentences.english: Boeing says it found problems in the process used to reach the decision.
sentences.chinese: 波音公司表示他在过去做出决定的过程中发现了问题。

sentences.english: He drilled the ball past the pitcher.
sentences.chinese: 他使球越过投手直飞过去。

sentences.english: The owl swooped down on a mouse.
sentences.chinese: 猫头鹰向一只老鼠飞扑过去。

sentences.english: The most extreme winds are now blowing 10 percent faster than they used to.
sentences.chinese: 现在最大的风速比过去增快了10%。

sentences.english: Teachers in schools have been rubbished for the last ten years.
sentences.chinese: 过去十年学校教师一直受抨击。

definition: to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of
to come and go/to have friendly relations with/in the past/previous
this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
despite/although/even though/in spite of/unhesitatingly/do not hesitate (to ask, complain etc)/(go ahead and do it) without hesitating
that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
